intro: Adenolobus mossamedensis, commonly known as the Mossamedes adenolobus, is a rare and endemic moss species found primarily in the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the family Pottiaceae, which includes many drought-tolerant mosses adapted to harsh environments. The plant exhibits a compact, cushion-like growth form, which helps it retain moisture and withstand extreme temperatures. Its leaves are typically narrow and strongly curled, a characteristic feature of many desert mosses. Adenolobus mossamedensis plays a vital ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing microhabitats for other desert organisms.
